The Extended Integer (XInt) Library

Thread-Safe Operation

This library, by default, can only safely be used in one thread at a time. If you need thread-safe operation, you must compile it with the thread-safe option enabled (see below), and you must ensure that only one thread ever accesses a particular integer at a time. The library cannot automatically provide this protection without an unacceptably severe speed penalty.

To enable thread-safe operations, define the preprocessor symbol XINT_THREADSAFE when compiling the library. You don't need to define it when using the library, only when compiling it.

To see whether your copy was compiled with thread-safe operation enabled, use the xint::opt_thread_safe function.
